newsitem.title: USA: U.S. propane holds steady, cargoes on horizon.
newsitem.headline: U.S. propane holds steady, cargoes on horizon.

text.p: U.S. spot propane prices stayed steady in moderate midday trade on Thursday, finding support from NYMEX futures and short covering that outweighed bearish propane inventory data, players said Thursday.
The monthly Energy Information Administration report late Wednesday showed the largest build in April since 1993.
Stocks climbed 6.1 million barrels to 32.2 million as of April 30, which is 7 million barrels above year-ago levels.

"The report is bearish but crude and products kept propane up," said a U.S. Gulf trader. Another player in the Conway, Kansas, hub added that some short covering in the material also helped keep this home heating fuel and petrochemical stock from weakening.
NYMEX oil prices and gasoline both rallied early Thursday on technical strength and talk of refinery snags in the Gulf.
"If crude falls, then I think our market will come down," added the Gulf trader.
Meanwhile, an international source said a U.S. Gulf terminal will be taking delivery shortly of a 40,000 tonne cargo of propane from Algeria's state-owned Sonatrach.
Another cargo of at least 30,000 tonnes is also scheduled for arrival at the same terminal from Sonatrach around June 16.
In the U.S. Gulf, spot propane traded at 35.00 cents and 34.75 cents. Conway, Kansas, hub material swapped hands at 35.75 cents.
Normal butane prices stayed largely steady although isobutane gained ground in catch up to normal's rise earlier in the week.
A Conway isobutane deal was done at 46.00, a half cent above Wednesday.
